nodes.text: If you want to fit in here at Hero University, then you will need to accept one fact - I am the leader of the Disbarred Bards class.
I can't think of anything more to say to Caesari right now.
Get out of here!
I guess I'll just leave Sosi to his misery.
Care to test your meager gaming skills against mine?
The less I talk to Caesari, the more I like it.
Are you ready to find out what a real game of cards is like?
I have nothing more to say to Sosi today.
You are a very irritating person. Go bother someone else.
I've had enough of Sosi.
Admit it, O'Conner, you're the thief around here. I look forward to seeing you expelled, so confess quickly and get it over with.
I'd rather be killing Drats than talking more with Sosi.
Thief or not - you insult this place by your mere existence!
Why don't you do everyone a favor and go back to the gutter where you belong?
Talking more with Sosi is a waste of time.
I'm looking forward to taking all your money.
I've got better things to do than talk more with Sosi.
The midterm is almost here. Why don't you leave now to avoid failing?
There's only so much of Sosi's smug face that I can stomach right now.
I'm going to make you wish that you had been expelled from this school.
Speaking with Sosi is like hitting my head repeatedly against a wall... it feels so much better when I stop.
I have no interest in talking to you.
Say farewell to your Lyra, Conner. They will be mine before the evening is over.
I'll wipe that smirk off your face, Conner. Just start the Poobah game.
Get out of here and leave me!
Would you like to play...
I have no interest in having anything to do with you. Period.
So, would you like to play a game of Poobah?
I will be delighted to win all your money anytime. Let us do this.
I thought you might like to have this bottle of fine wine. It's very good.
Why are you giving me this?
I respect you and your position in class, sir. I hope that I can make up for some of the disrespect I have shown you in the past.
Very well - but show more respect toward me in the future or things will not go well for you.
I don't trust you, Conner, particularly not when you are acting nice towards me. I'll have someone else check it for poison.
You are a dangerous person, Caesari. I don't want to make an enemy of you. This is an attempt to make up for my insolence in the past.
<nod> Very well, O'Conner - I accept your tribute.
You'd better not be trying to pull something over on me. I won't put up with your tricks.
I'm giving you this gift because I know how much you like and respect me. I just wanted to show that our feelings are mutual.
You're up to something, Conner. It will backfire on you.
I would like you to have another bottle of fine wine as a sign of my admiration for you.
<nod>
I found this special bottle of Golden Wine, sir, and I wanted to show my respect by giving it to you.
Golden Wine is an impressive gift. I accept it.
I uncovered this very valuable bottle of Dryad's Kiss wine, and there is only one person in this entire castle who is worthy of such a prize. Please accept it as your due.
You are surprisingly correct - this wine would be wasted on anyone other than me. Good.
I'd like you to have this rose as a token of our friendship.
Why in the world would you think that I would want a gesture of friendship from you - or a rose? How gauche.
There's nothing I want to give to Caesari... except maybe a punch in the nose.
I challenge you to a round of darts.
You think you can beat me at darts? We shall see about that.
This is a worthless game! What a waste of time. You clearly cheat.
These darts are clearly inferior - they don't throw properly.
My skill at this game is far superior to yours.
Clearly only peasants play that game. I have no interest in playing it.
I challenge you to a game of billiards.
I will play with you only if you are willing to make it worth wasting my time with you. Shall we make a little wager here of say... fifty Lyra... on the outcome?
I'll take that bet.
Good. I can always use a little spare cash.
Sorry, I don't have the money right now.
Well then, don't waste any more of my time.
I have no interesting in betting with you.
You don't like losing, do you?
It will give me a great deal of pleasure to beat you at this game - and everything else. I am an expert Billiards player.
I have no interest in playing against someone who obviously must cheat to win.

nodes.message: Sosi ignores Shawn's wins when playing for free

nodes.text: Even a beginner can get lucky sometimes.
You won that one. It won't happen again.
You did not deserve that win.
Looks like I'm now better at this game than you are, doesn't it?
I don't believe it. You must be cheating!
Nevertheless, I won the wager again, didn't I, Caesari?
I don't know how you did it, Conner, but I'll never play in a rigged game with you again. Take the damn money!
You've had nothing but luck this game. Dumb luck - or else you are cheating.
What's the matter, Caesari? Are you trying to weasel out of paying your gambling debts?
There - take it.
How did you...? You got lucky with that last shot!
Maybe... or maybe I'm just better at this game now than you are.
There's no way in Hades that you are better at Billiards than I am!
Well, we can always play again sometime and find out, can't we? For now, you owe me fifty Lyra.
You can take the money. I'll just win it all back the next time we play.
I win, of course. Now pay me the fifty Lyra you wagered with me.
You owe me fifty Lyra for wasting my time by being such a terrible player.
You lose yet again... and I believe you owe me some Lyra, don't you, Conner?

You seem to make a habit of losing to me, Conner. Perhaps next time, we can make the game more interesting wagering on the outcome. That way, I will enjoy winning your money as much as I enjoy beating you.
You lose. It's clearly a metaphor for your life, isn't it?
Think you have a chance against me in a card game?
Only if you are willing to put your money where you cards are. Shall we wager 10 Lyra a game?
I'll take that bet.
Good. I can always use a little spare cash.
Sorry, I don't have the money right now.
Well then, don't waste any more of my time.
I have no interesting in betting with you.
You don't like losing, do you?
It will give me a great deal of pleasure to beat you at this game - and everything else.
Clearly only peasants play that game. I have no interest in playing it.
Unbelievable! If I ever catch you cheating at cards again, I'll have you thrown out of this school!
Hmmm... didn't we have a Gentleman's Agreement on this game?
You are no gentleman, Conner. You are nothing but a peasant!
Peasant or not, we did have a wager. Pay up or will I let everyone know just how well you keep your word as a gentleman.
Take the money!
Thank you, Caesari. It was a pleasure playing with you.
What did you do - mark the cards? You clearly don't have the intelligence to win fairly.
I still beat you. Where's the money you owe me?
There! Take it.
You won? I don't believe it. You had too much luck this game.
Cards require both Luck and Skill - you should know that by now, Caesari. But you still owe me ten Lyra.
You can have the Lyra for now... We'll see what happens the next time we play.
Perhaps you should have practiced against some of the lesser players before taking on a master of the game. That will be 10 Lyra.
I win again. Thus, I believe you owe me some Lyra...
Maybe you should stick with games at which you have a chance, if there is such a game. You owe me 10 Lyra for the lesson.
If you wish to play cards with me again, you will have to give me some incentive. Perhaps a modest wager will assuage my boredom.
I'm clearly better at this than you are.
